message.content:
<<<api>>>: TypedArray.getString
<<<code>>>: 
In your attrs.xml file:
<declare-styleable name="CustomKey">
    <attr name="alternativeKeyLabel" format="string"/>
</declare-styleable>

In your layout file:
<com.yourpackage.CustomKey
    xmlns:custom="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
    custom:alternativeKeyLabel="Alternative Label"
    ... />

In your CustomKey class:
TypedArray a = context.obtainStyledAttributes(attrs, R.styleable.CustomKey);
String alternativeLabel = a.getString(R.styleable.CustomKey_alternativeKeyLabel);
a.recycle();
<<<explanation>>>: To create custom properties for XML in Android, you need to declare them in a resource file (usually named attrs.xml). Then, you can use these properties in your layout file by defining a new namespace and using it to prefix the custom attribute. Finally, in your custom class, you can obtain the custom attributes using the obtainStyledAttributes() method and use them as needed. Don't forget to recycle the TypedArray after use to free up memory.
